<NE><HG><HL>Φίλιππος</HL><Infl>ου</Infl><PS>m</PS></HG> <nS1><Tr>Philip<Expl>name of several rulers of Macedonia, after 350 BC usu. ref. to Philip II, 382–336 BC</Expl></Tr><Au>Hdt.<NBPlus/></Au></nS1> <RelW><HG><HL>Φιλιππεῖος</HL><Infl>ου</Infl><PS>m</PS></HG><nS1><Tr>stater of Philip, Macedonian stater<Expl>ref. to gold coins used to fund Philip's campaigns</Expl></Tr><Au>Plu.</Au></nS1></RelW> <RelW><vHG><HL>Φιλιππίζω</HL><PS>vb</PS></vHG> <vS1> <Indic>of persons, the Pythian oracle</Indic> <Tr>support Philip, be on Philip's side</Tr><Au>Att.orats. <AE><HG><HL>φιλο-γυμναστής</HL><Infl>οῦ</Infl><PS>masc.adj</PS></HG> <aS1><Tr>devoted to gymnastic exercise, fond of exercise</Tr><Au>Pl.</Au></aS1></AE>

<AE><HG><HL>φιλο-δέσποτος</HL><Infl>ον</Infl><PS>adj</PS><Ety><Ref>δεσπότης</Ref></Ety></HG> <aS1><Indic>of a slave</Indic><Tr>loyal to one's master</Tr><Au>Hdt.</Au><aS2><Indic>pejor., of the populace</Indic><Tr>servile</Tr><Au>Thgn.</Au></aS2></aS1></AE>

<AE><HG><HL>φιλό-δημος</HL><Infl>ον</Infl><PS>adj</PS><Ety><Ref>δῆμος</Ref></Ety></HG> <aS1><Indic>of a politician, an action</Indic><Tr>loving the people, looking after the interests of the people</Tr><Au>Ar.</Au></aS1></AE>
<AE><HG><HL>φιλο-δίκαιος</HL><Infl>ον</Infl><PS>adj</PS></HG> <aS1><Indic>of persons, the Athenian people</Indic><Tr>prizing justice, loving to see justice done</Tr><Au>Arist. Plu.</Au></aS1></AE>

<AE><HG><HL>φιλό-δωρος</HL><Infl>ον</Infl><PS>adj</PS><Ety><Ref>δῶρον</Ref></Ety></HG> <aS1><Tr>fond of giving gifts</Tr><Au>Plu.</Au></aS1> <aS1><Tr>generous</Tr><Au>X.</Au><aS2><Indic><GLbl>w.gen.</GLbl>w. one's goodwill</Indic><Au>Pl.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>of an action</Indic><Tr>done out of generosity</Tr><Au>D.</Au></aS2></aS1> <Adv><vHG><HL>φιλοδώρως</HL><PS>adv</PS></vHG> <advS1><Tr>generously</Tr><Au>Pl.</Au></advS1> </Adv></AE>

<AE><HG><HL>φιλό-θεος</HL><Infl>ον</Infl><PS>adj</PS><Ety><Ref>θεός</Ref></Ety></HG> <aS1><Indic>of fortunate men</Indic><Tr>loving the gods, grateful to the gods</Tr><Au>Arist.</Au></aS1></AE>

<AE><HG><HL>φιλ-οικοδόμος</HL><Infl>ον</Infl><PS>adj</PS></HG> <aS1><Tr>fond of erecting buildings</Tr><Au>X. Plu.</Au><aS2><Tr>fond of engaging in architecture</Tr><Au>Arist.</Au></aS2></aS1></AE>

<VE><vHG><HL>φιλομαθέω</HL><PS>contr.vb</PS><Ety><Ref>φιλομαθής</Ref></Ety></vHG> <vS1> <Tr>be fond of studying</Tr><Au>Pl. Plb.</Au><vS2><Tr>engage in study</Tr><Au>Plb. Plu.</Au></vS2> </vS1> </VE>

<AE><HG><HL>φιλό-μαστος</HL><Infl>ον</Infl><PS>adj</PS><Ety><Ref>μαστός</Ref></Ety></HG> <aS1><Indic>of young animals</Indic><Tr>desiring the breast</Tr><Au>A.</Au><aS2><Indic>gener.</Indic><Tr>of suckling age, unweaned</Tr><Au>A.</Au></aS2></aS1></AE>

<NE><HG><HL>Φιλομήλᾱ</HL><Infl>ᾱς</Infl><PS>f</PS></HG> <nS1><Tr>Philomela<Expl>mythol. princess of Athens, raped by her brother-in-law Tereus and turned into a swallow or nightingale by the gods</Expl></Tr><Au>D. Arist.</Au></nS1></NE>
